entries.title: Dr. Stone: Science Future Part 2
entries.jpTitle: 『Dr.STONE SCIENCE FUTURE』第4期最終シーズン第2クール

review.en:
Episode #9: Our Dr. STONE

It was totally insane—but honestly, kind of amazing.Getting hit by a machine gun at close range should be an instant kill, no question.Sure, the enemy—especially the American base—probably didn't want to kill anyone, but still… it's hard to believe everyone made it out alive.And yet, watching them charge ahead, fully committed to the path of science Senku's led them on, felt genuinely powerful.Yeah, it's full of those 'wait… seriously?' moments, no doubt.But I can't help but applaud the sheer passion and conviction that makes this kind of entertainment work.That said… how exactly do they plan to reverse the global petrification? It's not like they're counting another few thousand years, right?Does Senku still have some nitric acid on hand?Also—what was that global voice signal from space all about? Was that really Senku's voice…? Or am I just forgetting something obvious?
review.jp:
第9話: Our Dr. STONE

『無茶苦茶だ、でも素晴らしかった。正直至近距離からのマシンガン直撃は即死レベルでしょう。確かに敵方も（特に北米基地においては）"殺したくはない"という心理が働いているだろうが、そうもいかない状況だろう。だから恐らく数人からもっと多くのメンツは助からないんじゃないかな?とも思う。ただしセンクウが導いてきた、そしてみんなで信じて歩んできた"科学の道"を未来につなげるために、覚悟を持って突き進むというのは非常に熱くて良かった。重ねていうが「おいおい・・・それはちょっと・・・」満載なのは間違いない。しかし、その圧倒的情熱と信念のもたらすエンタテイメントに拍手を送ろうではないか。さて、全人類石化からどう回復するつもり?また何千年数えるわけじゃないでしょ?センクウが手元に硝酸持ってるのかな?あと、宇宙からの通信で地球全土をターゲットにした音声って?あれってセンクウの声?何にも覚えてないのだけど、それは私だけでしょうか?』

entries.romanized_title: Dr. Stone: Science Future 4th Season 2nd Cour
entries.synopsis: The second cour of the fourth season of Dr.STONE.

entries.title: Turkey! Time to Strike

review.en:
Episode #9: Right in the Pocket Together

The moment when Akebi (the blue-haired girl from the past) finally reunites with her counterpart, Rina (the blue-haired girl from the future), was truly powerful—especially since it's now Rina, who used to be emotionally tangled and withdrawn, stepping forward to gently guide Akebi instead. That emotional reversal carried real weight.

And it's thanks to Mai, the club president, who's quietly endured her own painful experiences and always wished for everyone to stay together. She was the one who helped bring everyone into the same space, and you could really feel her heart behind it.

Sure, the idea that each of the sisters had been acting separately, yet somehow it all ends up being "for Akebi's sake" might come off a bit too convenient. But with all the buildup so far, I could accept that—and honestly, it hit home more than a little.

Some of the secret room antics felt a little farcical, and I did find certain voice performances a bit flat.But hey—I'm more than happy to overlook all of that. The episode had heart.
review.jp:
第9話: みんなでジャストポケット

『最後に利奈ちゃんに対応する朱火ちゃん（青髪同士のペア）が揃い、そしてここまでに成長してきた（未来からのこじらせキャラ）利奈が朱火を諭すという構図はとても良かった。そしてそこに皆を持ってこれたのは、自身が本当につらい経験をして、だからこそ、みんなが共にあることをいつも願う部長の麻衣だというのもいい。姉妹の各々が一見バラバラにしていたことは全て朱火のためだった — というのも、若干都合がいいけどこれまで描いてきたものがあるから許せるし、多少なりとも心を打つ。隠し部屋がバレた辺りのやり取りは多少茶番じみていたし、演技が微妙に思えるところもあったけど、喜んで多目にみようではないか。』

entries.synopsis: "Turkey" is a bowling term for scoring three consecutive strikes.  Mai, a second-year student and captain of the Ikkokukan High School Bowling Club, is a genius who can't seem to win a match. Whenever she scores a Turkey, she mysteriously follows it up with an unyielding split—the Snake Eyes.  One day, Rina, the club’s only first-year member, confronts her "You’re doing it on purpose, aren’t you?"  "You’re running away from winning. But I want to win. If you have no intention of winning, I’ll quit."

entries.title: April Showers Bring May Flowers

review.en:
Episode #10: The Sweet and Spicy Storm Area

Both parts of the episode were brilliant.Uguisudani, the beautiful and popular girl who had always put on a likable persona and played the part of the perfect classmate, finally shows signs of real growth.Sure, the timing of Gotanda's presence—her supportive friend who helps bring about that change—feels a little too convenient. But I'll allow it.

Uguisudani's development feels satisfying precisely because we've seen her arc from the very beginning.Even Shinbashi's quiet kindness and steady growth serve as a warm, grounding contrast.

And then there's the central question:"Why does Ueno like Tabata?"

Instead of giving us a direct answer, the show lets us glimpse Tabata's charm through the eyes of a few key characters—like Gotanda, Shinbashi, and even Uguisudani herself.That indirect approach is surprisingly effective.

Of course, the show's usual brand of "ridiculously convenient timing" makes another appearance in the blackout scene—Ueno just so happens to show up at the perfect moment.But honestly, that's not the point.The emotional richness and subtle character beats make it all worth it.
review.jp:
第10話: ❀あまくてからい、暴風域

『ABパート共に素晴らしき第10話。計算高く役割を演じる、人気者の美人鶯谷の成長も、その成長を助長する植野っちの友人五反田の立ち位置も、多少ご都合タイミング過ぎるけどいい。そんな鶯谷も初期の頃から今までの流れがあるからこそ、見ている此方側も彼女の変化を嬉しく感じることが出来る。また地味ながら新橋くんの成長と暖かさも良いスパイス。そしてやはり、"何故植野っちは田端をいいと思うのか?"という疑問に対する答えを、他の人々の目を通して描いているのもいい。最後の学校に戻ってからの停電二人っきりなど、相変わらずいつも通り全てがご都合タイミングだけど、伝えたいことはそこじゃないし他に魅力が溢れているのでいいとします。』

entries.synopsis: Hana Tabata is a lonely and unpopular high school girl with negative thoughts. Early morning in the classroom when she was pretending to be a manga heroine, the class's good looking Yosuke accidentally saw her...!? This love, you will definitely want to support it! Masochistic system unpopular girl comedy!

entries.title: Dekin no Mogura: The Earthbound Mole

review.jp:
第9話: 偉大な母の愛

『まさに横溝正史の世界。しかし、よくもまぁ1話にここまでの内容を詰め込んだな。それも非常に面白く、テンポもよく・・・すごい構成力。また、一見霊や祟、怨霊的なことばかりを言っているようだが、実際はほぼ全て人の所業ってのも良し。第9話まできて、其々のキャラの魅力がしっかり定着しているのもいい。島を牛耳るやべぇ一家。茶髪の娘（八重ちゃん）の父親を始めとした家族もキャラが立ってていい。そして前回に続いて祓い屋猫つかいの息子も輝いている。さて、、モグラも言っていたが、森君は如何にして病むことになったのだろう?次回も楽しみ。』

entries.synopsis: "I won't die 'cause I was banned from the afterlife."  A shady self-proclaimed hermit named Momoyuki Mogura, AKA: Mogura, is banned from the afterlife due to an incident. Now he collects spirit possessed will-o'-wisps in his lantern, hoping to make a comeback.  It seems that those who encounter him begin to see peculiar things.

entries.title: Ruri Rocks

review.en:
Episode #9: Time Capsle of 1.9 Million Tons

What stood out in this episode was how beautifully it wove together the themes from the last one—particularly the idea that nature, once touched by human hands, enters a gray zone where good and bad can't be cleanly separated.

The fashion show in Part A, where Nagi suddenly changes outfits, felt over-the-top at first. Nagi, who normally couldn't care less about what she wears, ends up modeling all sorts of flashy clothes—maid outfits included—brought by Imari, who insists it's time to glam her up. Even Shoko can't help but be drawn to the outfits, hesitating for a moment before Ruri calls her away.

It felt absurd—but also kind of sweet. Maybe that whole scene was a metaphor in itself: girls are drawn to what sparkles, in all its forms. The episode doesn't deny that. But in the end, it reminds us that what truly shines isn't flashy clothing—it's something much deeper.

In the early scenes, we see Ruri and Shoko growing closer. Their personalities are so different, yet they begin to connect. And with each new connection, Ruri starts to trust her own judgment more—something that speaks to how far she's come.

The dam—a literal structure, but also a metaphor—becomes a focal point. There are those who support it and those who oppose it. Just like with nature, there's no single, simple answer.

Then comes the rain. Heavy rainfall leads the dam to release water, which in turn dislodges opals that had quietly gathered at the bottom over time.

It's a moment born of coincidence, maybe even miracle. But what made it truly beautiful wasn't just the glittering stones—it was the girls, glowing in their presence. Not because the opals shone, but because they could feel the passage of time, the forces of nature, the quiet intertwining of humanity and the world.

On the way home, the scene lingers on quiet details—the white line between the sidewalk and the road, the gentle transitions through a sleepy town. Ruri stays awake while the others doze off, gazing out the window. She sees an older woman doting on her dog, children playing with roof tiles, and a girl holding a gleaming opal up to the fading sun.

When Nagi asks, "Were you awake?" Ruri simply replies, "Yeah. I was looking outside."

That one line hit me.

I don't know why, but it did.

Maybe because it captured everything:Her growth. Her openness. Her ability now to see not just stones, but the stories behind them—people, towns, time, weather, accidents, history, connection.

That white line between the sidewalk and the road—it wasn't just a line. It felt like a river, flowing quietly beneath everything.

The opals, too, didn't just "appear." They had been resting at the bottom of the dam for who knows how long—formed over thousands of years, and now suddenly freed by a storm. Carried downstream, gently, silently.

And as Ruri and the others drove down from the mountain, it felt like they were tracing that same path—descending the river of time, carried by everything that had come before them.

That final shot of the girl discovering an opal in the shallows, holding it to the sunset—it wasn't just a pretty moment. It was the continuation of something much older, something passed along, something precious.

The dam held a time capsule of 1.9 million tons. But it's not just a number. It's everything that has settled there: time, memories, sediment, history, light.

And now, piece by piece, those fragments are returning to the world—flowing through rivers, through people, through towns.

Ruri saw it. Felt it.

That's why she looked outside.That's why she glowed.


Afterword

Looking back on it, I couldn't help but think that the thin white line between the sidewalk and the road was more than just a line. It felt like a river, flowing steadily downstream—from the mountain's heights, through the lives of people in towns below, carrying with it both what nature has spent ages shaping and what humanity has built with its own hands.

The dam, with its 1.9 million tons of water, was like a time capsule. What had slept quietly inside—sediment, minerals, fragments of history—was released, carried along, and returned to the world. That flow reached not only rivers and shallows, but also the daily lives of people who might never notice it.

And as Ruri looked outside on the way back—at the quiet town, at people and small moments of life—it felt as if her eyes were reflecting that same current. Perhaps she wasn't even "thinking" about it. She was simply feeling it: the weight of years, the gift of nature, and the way it all flows into human lives.

That's why her one line—"I was looking outside"—hit so deeply.Because in that simple reply, everything was already there.
review.jp:
第9話:190万トンのタイムカプセル

『これまでの流れ、特に前回の"自然に人の手が加わる"、"善い・悪いという2つの観点でジャッジできないことが殆どだ"というテーマが繋がっていたのがいい。Aパートの凪の"巨乳見せつけ"のファッションショーはどうにも・・・だが、女子は輝くものに弱い、形はどうであれ・・・ということが言いたかったのかな?とも思えたのでまぁいいだろう（結局、輝いているのは格好がどうということではないというのが最後描かれていたし）。そして序盤、瑠璃と硝子が着実に違った個性が交わり親交が深まっていく様、これまで無かったものを見つけた時、成長している瑠璃が自分の考えで判断できるようになって来ているのも良かった。ダムひとつとっても賛成派も反対派もいて、その善し悪しなんかもとても一言でジャッジは出来ない。今回はそれがいろんな形で人間が自然と関わっている一つの形—カタリストとしての役割を担うものとして提示されていたのだろう。そのダムが豪雨の影響でもたらした（底に溜まっていた）オパールの排出を通して、自然と人間の関わり、時の経過などを経て、その中で天候など様々なことが作用・影響しあって形成されていくものがあって・・・といったことを素晴らしい形で見せてくれた。偶然や奇跡が生んだオパールの排出だが、その美しいオパール溜りで彼女たちが輝いていたのは、そういったもの全ての恩恵であり、それを彼女たちが確かに感じているからだろうと思った。だからこそ、帰りの車の中で凪が起きてたの?と「問われ、「外を見ていた」と答える瑠璃が嬉しそうに輝いて見えたのも、そういった様々な形での人の営み、自然との関わり、自然そのものを感じていたからなのだろう。凪のもとで瑠璃が（他の皆もだが）着実に一つの道を進んでいっている様と、自然や人の歴史と時の流れの1つの道筋がどこか重なっているようにも感じた、そんな美しい回でした。あ、あと補足ですが、あのダムからの帰り道の車道と歩道の間の白線はダムから流れ出ている川の流れを意味してるのかなとも思いました。それは山の上の上流から人々の暮らしのある中流、下流へと流れて行きます。そこには地球／自然が長い長い年月の間に作り上げてきた様々なもの、人間の手が加わったからこそあるもの、色んなものが含まれているのでしょう。それらは190万トンの水の中に沈んだまるでタイムカプセルからの贈り物のようだなとも思いました。だからこそ、その川の流れを下っていく帰り道で、自然や人々の暮らしを見る瑠璃の瞳にはきっと長い年月と自然の恵み、それが人々の元に流れていっているという壮大な営みが映っていた、いや、ただ感じていたのかも知れません。だからこそ、そんな瑠璃の口から発せられた、「外を見ていた」と言うセリフになんとも言えず心を打たれたのでしょう。』

entries.synopsis: Mineral collecting is like a modern-day treasure hunt!  Ruri, a high school girl who loves jewelry and accessories, gets into the world of mineral collecting, venturing into mountains, rivers, and caves. The first volume features numerous minerals, including quartz, garnet, pyrite, gold sand, and fluorite. The manga is full of fascinating scenes focusing on specialized tools such as a panning dish, hammer, and topographical maps. An authentic scientific adventure based on the author's solid knowledge of mineralogy!

entries.title: The Fragrant Flower Blooms with Dignity

review.jp:
第10話: 青い嵐

『今回も男子同士の友情を中心に、じわじわと全体を深めるいい途中回だった。ファミレスで薫子、昴込みの皆で期末試験勉強をするAパート。女子よりも男子同士の関係に重点が置かれてたのが良かった。そして試験後みんなでボーリングへ。途中で薫子たちと車道を挟んですれ違うなか、赤髪キャラに薫子への想いを当てられ取り乱す凛太郎。コテコテ展開だがその後のボーリング場でのやり取りを含めて、男友達との関係と恋心をバランス良く丁寧に少しずつ描いていくさまに好印象。中々いい回だった。 （正直どれも苦手ではあるが）個人的にはCLOVERWORKS三銃士の中で一番見れる作品かな・・・。』

entries.romanized_title: Kaoru Hana wa Rin to Saku
entries.synopsis: Chidori High is a boys’ school that takes in the dregs of society with the lowest grades. Next door stands Kikyo Girls’ High, where the wealthy, high-class families send their precious daughters. Chidori second-year Rintaro, who has a fierce face but a gentle heart, is helping at his family’s patisserie when he meets a girl named Kaoruko. The two hit it off right away…but this blissful peace is quickly disturbed when Rintaro discovers that Kaoruko is actually a student at Kikyo. Worse, she doesn’t seem to realize what a huge problem this really is! Will these two be able to forge a path for themselves, and sidestep the traps (metaphorical and literal) laid by their classmates?

entries.title: Rent-a-Girlfriend Season 4
entries.jpTitle: 彼女、お借りします 第4期

review.jp:
第48話: 薬指と彼女

『ばあちゃんや両親を絡めることで正当化したり、ちょっといい話として"なしくずし"的にまとめるのはいい加減にして欲しい。とは思うが、今回はずっと存在を消していた両親がとてもいい動きをしたと言えよう。受け継がれる指輪、渡す側と受け取る側 — 両方の立場がわかる存在として母親が伝えたかったことなどはとても良かった。また、最後何を聞いたのかは分からないが、ばあちゃんを通して、間接的に瑠夏の気持ちが変わるのかも知れないのかなぁと思えたも良かった。ただ何れにしても、既に完膚なきまでの負けヒロインと、何の関係もない形ばかりのクソ元カノとかどうでもよくて、未だにレンカノがどうのと言ってる自己中女と、毎回ぎゃあぎゃあ告白がどうのと言ってうるさいヘタレくずの当人たちが一歩でも前進しない限りは、ちゃんと評価する気になれないのは確か。千鶴と和也母が一緒いるだけでつけてきて、指輪の件を立ち聞きしてけしからんがる麻美とか、まじで病気なだけ。今回は反則手だが、和也の母と祖母と父が良かったのでちょっとおまけ。』

entries.synopsis: Kazuya’s ready to confess with the lush paradise of Hawaii as a backdrop. But renting Chizuru for the dream trip turns into a war zone of love due to Ruka’s aggressive advances and Mami’s scheming. Despite the chaos, this is Kazuya’s moment to bare his heart. Will his words reach Chizuru? And if they do, what will she even say?

entries.title: My Dress-Up Darling Season 2
entries.jpTitle: その着せ替え人形は恋をする Season 2

review.en:
Episode #22: So, We're Gonna Do It All Right Now?!

Wait, was this really My Dress-Up Darling or an episode of Rent-A-Girlfriend? For 23 straight minutes, it felt like the latter—and it was torture. Not a single second felt genuinely entertaining.

Sure, Marin is cute… but is that really enough to carry an entire episode? If you're a diehard Marin fan, maybe. If not, there's just nothing here. And honestly, I can't help but wonder: is CloverWorks actually gifted at taking something with potential and draining the fun out of it?

The infamous "energy drink" gag was unbearable. Gojou, being the painfully earnest and clueless introvert he is, decides that the best way to handle staying overnight at Marin's is simply… not to sleep. So he grabs an energy drink at Don Quijote, determined to power through. Straightforward enough.

Except Marin sees him at the shelf next to some "extra stamina" boosters and totally misreads it. She convinces herself he's revved up in that way, and she spirals into full-blown panic mode. She literally blurts out "I'm definitely going to confess!"—making her feel exactly like Kazuya from Rent-A-Girlfriend, all hyped up and overreacting over nothing. It wasn't endearing, it was insufferable.

And the nonsense just piled up. Marin's supposed to be dieting, yet she wolfs down instant noodles at midnight and then casually sleeps until morning. This is a professional model who's about to show up at a cosplay event—seriously? Then there was the game sequence tied to the next cosplay theme. Yes, CloverWorks animated it with their usual polish, but honestly? It was well-crafted yet utterly irrelevant.

That's the core problem: Marin is already an ultra-popular, beautiful high school model. She conveniently has the perfect partner in Gojou—raised in a traditional dollmaker's household, skilled in sewing and makeup, and passionate enough to handcraft her costumes. She even eats dinner at his place almost every night, cooked by him and his grandfather, like it's the most natural thing in the world. And after all that, she still spends an entire episode melting down over a total misunderstanding. What's supposed to be funny just comes across as ridiculous.

In the end, it all boiled down to one thing: I just didn't care. Maybe others found this fun—I honestly don't know. But for me, watching it was exhausting.
review.jp:
第22話: 今から全部するってこと!?

『これは「ビス恋」ではなく「かのかり」だった!? そしてその23分間はまるで拷問のようだった。1秒たりとも面白い瞬間がなかった。海夢ちゃんが可愛い・・・と愛でることが出来る人が見ればいいのだろう。いや、そうでなければ見れない。それともやはりCLOVERWORKSは面白い作品を面白くなく作るのが得意な会社なのだろうか?そう思っているのは自分だけですか?エナジードリンクの勘違いも、あり得ないし。というかそもそも、謎に毎晩食事を食べに来る、しょっちゅう二人きりでいる、そして全く持って付き合ってもいない、五条くんは異常に古風で奥手で勘違いするはずがない。それでエナジードリンク（とは後で気づくがそれでも）如きでここまで意識過剰になる?問題はそれ自体ではなく、この一連の有り様を面白く描けてないってことなんだけど。。。そして更にダイエット中なのに夜中カップ麺食べてあっさり朝まで寝る?意味不明。ゲームの中身も凝ってたけど正直どうでもいい。オチもない。勝手に自分の中で盛り上がられても、ただ調子に乗っている美人でいい子が自爆してるだけの、"絶対告白するぞ!"の「かのかり」における"和也"状態。そこら辺りの想いに対しても応援したくなる要素も無い。超絶リア充の学生美人モデルが都合よく衣装を作ってくれる素晴らしい相方を見つけて、そしてご飯まで毎晩ごちそうになって勝手に好きになったのなってないのでドキドキして下着をどうので・・・・って。"どうでもいい"みんな楽しいの?これ見て。見てるのも辛い。やめたい。』

entries.romanized_title: Sono Bisque Doll wa Koi wo Suru Season 2
entries.synopsis: When Marin Kitagawa and Wakana Gojo met, they grew close over their love for cosplay. Through interacting with classmates and making new cosplay friends, Marin and Wakana’s world keeps growing. New developments arise as Marin’s love for Wakana continues to be filled with endless excitement. In their ever-expanding world, Marin and Wakana’s story of cosplay and thrills continues!
